Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2013 10:42AM CelineFlower wrote: starting tx next week.. had my first scan and dot tats...  my surgery was april 30th... and i am nervous waiting so long... but because of holidays etc...oh well whatever.. im just anxious to get the "end" of this journey started... I know ppl say we are brave... and ya i agree... i was terrified of chemo... still went... i was petrified of surgery... still went.. I am, horrified by rad tx... my mom (who was a lot sicker then i am ), died, of a heart attack she had during her LAST rad tx.... but im still going... Wounds...lessions... cuts, blood... i do very poorly with. Remouving my bandage after surgery made me throw up... but i will still go every day.. get up on the table and let them zap me.. yes i am brave.... but i'm also scared

Posts.Title: News That You Need To Hear ALK ALK

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2013 05:27AM CelineFlower wrote: onc wants yuou to stay at a consistent weight , because all his "calculations" are based on your weight entering treatment i am APPALED that a medical proffesional would not encourage a SAFE  way for you to get HEALTHY.. and not focuss on the scale as much i know i know... ppl can be fat and be healthy... many ppl truly believe that.... at my higest i was 265lbs approx (i rarely look at a scale, my husband monitors it for me ) .. i KNOW im not healthy at that weight.. i can feel it....most can.. loosing fat.. for me (and othe er + patients ) is ESSENTIAL i cant say this enough... fat produces estrogen... estrogen feeds cancer.. North americans have been lied to... manipulated and lulled into false beliefs about diest and excersuze for decades now... and the worst of it, is that its not for health reasons ...but for profit. When i got first diagnosed... i swore  i would never given this illness one more second then i need to... or feed it anymore.. i will never be fat again... no matter what weight i am... look in that mirror girl... fat ...or not... you are beautiful... you are loved...  you want to live... and live well... if this onc is telling you that loosing weight is bad... get a second opinion is my suggestion. please take care of yourself celineflower

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2014 11:17AM CelineFlower wrote: Ksk04...  this is not easy... and as a mom, you know you sometimes gotta do the tough stuff... Many situations like yours end up benign.. but yes some dont. You are very right to worry. But that doesnt mean its going to be bad news. 1st... ALWAYS get copies of your reports..  2nd .. Google can be useful if the research does not intensify your anxiety but rather helps you cope. 3rd... I am not sure the age of your kids.. but children pick up on these things.. dont be affraid to be honest with them if you feel the time is right And lastly... Do what ever you have to do to keep calm while you wait... have a drink.. smoke a joint.. go for a walk.. pray.. play with the kids ..  WHATEVER works... stress is a defining factor in this battle.. You are not alone..  be well peace in celie

Posts.Title: Dense breasts - should I be worried? tlm1 farmerlucy

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2013 07:14AM - edited Jan 24, 2013 07:15AM by CelineFlower welcome to the waiting room... lots of ppl here to keep you company... lots of stuff to read.. not knowing is hard... but it wont be like that forever... here is my opinion... collected from ny own experiences... everyones path is different 1- you have dense breasts... most of us do and it makes it harder to see.  2- A  black spot, perfectly round... tells me it could be a cyst (most lumps are)  3- They will do a biopsy (because they can feel it) and i suggest you watch the screen.. i would bet once the needle goes in... you will see the cyst deflating (btw biopsy are mostly painless) You will not know for sure till u get the biopsy report .. but 80% of lumps are bening..hold onto that. Heres some advice while you wait... 1- Collect ALL reports... take notes..keep a journal and bring someone to the appointements with you that will help you keep info straight. 2- If you are unhappy with your doc..get a second opinion  3- If researching and reading stuff, is making you scared ... stop 4- If not knowing anything is driving you nutz... read/research (double check ALL websites) 5- Grab a drink... a cup of tea... or take a ride on a purple bubble 6- remember you are not alone, you are strong and you are loved. be well, flower
